parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A propitiation (of an angry god), atoning sacrifice. Atonement, i.e. an expiator.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Alone, but, only. Neuter of monos as adverb; merely.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 1st Person Plural
str2: Our, our own. From thnetos; our.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
